website_summaries.verdict: A high quality individual boring bar that is perfect for general use on most machining projects.
pros: 6" length and 3/8" diameter offer good reach for deeper bore holes
Hardened steel will last a while before needing attention
Can be used for finishing bore holes
cons: Use on steel may be slower and less accurate than more premium bore bars

customer_reviews.title: As expected due to the 3/8 diameter you have to keep it choked up pretty tight to avoid chatter
customer_reviews.text: I got this to go along with the 5/8 version which is outstanding. As expected due to the 3/8 diameter you have to keep it choked up pretty tight to avoid chatter. Works well alongside the 5/8 version though, I start the bore with this one then move to the 5/8 for final boring and better finish.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product overall with a couple of minor faults...
customer_reviews.text: Very well built and finished. Minus One Star for a technical fault: The "Depth Scale" etched on the boring bar is marked incorrectly in inches - it appears to be marked in 2mm (measured) increments. The numbers are meaningless and the depth marks are confusing (see photo). They ~did~ etch what type of insert you need on the boring bar, we well as supply a decent quality insert with it so you won't have to rummage through documentation to get replacement inserts.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Helton

customer_reviews.title: I think better information sent with the tool or in the ad ...
customer_reviews.text: Received the tool and immediately put it to work. It took a little bit to get the tool dialed in to make a smooth cut. I think better information sent with the tool or in the ad about the type of cutting bit attached would have been helpful. Yeh, I probably could have searched what that particular bit was suited for but why not include it in the write-up? I might have ordered different bits for it at the same time. Also the best angle to use the tool would have helped. Small instruction sheet with tool for best practices? Once it was dialed in, it did cut straight, accurate and created a smooth surface. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: buck

customer_reviews.title: Works Well!
customer_reviews.text: Works well. There are flats ground on three surfaces, so don't buy a toolholder with a 'V' ground in the bottom like I did. Please note that the minimum bore size is .866 inches. Almost immediately, I needed to bore a hole that was a little smaller. Three other 5/8" boring bars I see on Amazon can do .682 or .790 or .812 inches. Unfortunately, I find myself wishing I'd bought one of those instead!
customer_reviews.author: Consumerater

customer_reviews.title: Not too happy with mine
customer_reviews.text: Mine has about a 15 degree down angle on the part where the insert attaches. Not sure if they all are like that but this one does not cut well and makes a screeching noise even with oil and can only male a .005 cut without really making a lot of noise and smoke. Tried cutting on center slightly above and below center, makes no difference.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: This is my go to boring bar now- I was using cemented carbide before
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to boring bar now- I was using cemented carbide before. MUCH better finish while internal boring. Very rigid. Nice to know I have the length if I need it but like that I can mount it very close when I don't need the reach.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Not 1/2" on flats
customer_reviews.text: This boring bar sits .240" below center. Measures 1/2" diameter but when securing in a 1/2" tool holder moves insert .240" below center. Must shim so it was returned for a 5/8 .625" to machine down to correct specs we needed.
customer_reviews.author: BobbyD

customer_reviews.title: Admittedly that was when boring a steel coupling
customer_reviews.text: Work's well when shortened up, but it does chatter when extended to max length. Admittedly that was when boring a steel coupling. I suspect if you were boring brass or aluminum it would be fine.
customer_reviews.author: pvpagpap

customer_reviews.title: A quality 3/8" shank boring bar
customer_reviews.text: An added bonus is the 3" scale embossed on the top of the boring bar (which was not included in the description). It made the project easy. The bar has adequate rigidity to avoid excess flex. The flex consistency (very little "push") made boring to the final bore diameter quick to obtain. A very good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: George M. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price,
customer_reviews.text: Useless for my needs. Will only scratch tool steels. May be ok for very soft mild steel, alum, brass etc. Did not come with wrench as shown. Had to give 1 star because there is no 0 stars
customer_reviews.author: big country

customer_reviews.title: Great Boring Bar
customer_reviews.text: I use this small boring bar all the time. It is easy to set up with its flat top. Does a nice job of boring with a good finish. The price is right. Buy one, you'll like it.
customer_reviews.author: CptnRon

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: Loved it! I work at a gear shop and im very impressed. At first i thought it would chatter way too much or not hold the tolerances needed but it kept up. Came with an insert (which i replaced due to the material being machined). Also came with the torx handle. Very Happy would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my company's manual lathe. It has nice clear 1/8" marks on it which help when you are machining and determining where to hold the bore bar. The insert is replaceable although it hasn't worn on us yet. Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: 27 year old male

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The tool itself is well built and a good bargain. Tested on both aluminum and 12L14, and cut chatter-free in both (bar extended 3" with a .005 DOC). The wrench for the insert is a piece of junk and was tossed.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: well made - strong - worked perfectly on my first ever insde cut. no chatter
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: ... compared to other more expensive tooling this thing is great. I will probably go with better inserts but ...
customer_reviews.text: Considering the price compared to other more expensive tooling this thing is great. I will probably go with better inserts but the boring bar itself works hreat
customer_reviews.author: Mike Gamble

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is an excellent purchase. My work is light in comparison to a production shop. I get into stainless and some 4140 but I have the luxury of light cuts and can take my time as a hobbyist. This boring bar suits my needs.
customer_reviews.author: J. E. Tener

customer_reviews.title: decent
customer_reviews.text: Works good on the mini lathe. Some vibration and chatter at depths over 2 inches. Need to slow the feeds and speeds to keep a clean cut.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must have accessory
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing, it has saved my but. If it does so maybe 5 more times than it will pay for itself
customer_reviews.author: Addison James Richert

customer_reviews.title: Can be used in adjustable boring head for mill
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly, flat sides were no problem in round fixture hole
customer_reviews.author: Ken A Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Very well built tool holder
customer_reviews.text: Very nice boring bar. The insert on the tool is very good. The boring bar has flats on four sides makes it easy to use with just about any tool holder you have. Very pleased with the results and would not be afraid to buy other tooling from Accusize tools.
customer_reviews.author: Jon F.

customer_reviews.title: Accusize Boring Bar.
customer_reviews.text: Seems I said something about these tools before and that is they are excellent no need to to go to higher priced bare. J.D.S.

customer_reviews.title: The inserts are a little expensive, but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed by the quality of this tool. The finish it produces with brass is second to none. I would definitely recommend it to a friend or colleague.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Orr

customer_reviews.title: Boring bar
customer_reviews.text: I received the boring bar in a timely manner. I set it up over the weekend and from all appearances it will work fine. I am a home hobby machinist as far as this is concerned and your products allow me to add to my tooling inventory without breaking the bank. Thanks and keep up the good work.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Moore

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bargain!
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable value for the price,compare at MSC for $100 minimum! As a 25+ year machinist I can guarantee this is an awesome value.
customer_reviews.author: Larkin Bray

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.
customer_reviews.text: I only gave it 4 stars because I haven't tried it on steel yet, but on aluminum it has worked great. I admit I only have a mini lathe so I don't take deep cuts (.015" max), but it has performed very well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Danger

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain, good quality.  Laser etch depth gauge nice touch
customer_reviews.text: Great bargain, works as good as my domestic high end brand at 1/10th cost.
customer_reviews.author: tim

customer_reviews.title: My husband really likes it.
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes it. Is exactly what he needed & wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Lilacs & Roses

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I dont know if the tool is good or not, all I got was empty paper bag.
customer_reviews.author: peter vance

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as pictured, comes in a hard square plastic tube/box like an end mill would.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used yet and bought for a hobby lathe ( Atlas TH48) but it is just like other small quality boring bars that i've used professionally.
customer_reviews.author: James M Young

customer_reviews.title: Missing allen tool.
customer_reviews.text: 1/2 " boring bar looks and works good but did not come with an allen tool to remove carbide insert.
customer_reviews.author: Dave S.

customer_reviews.title: This boring bar was just what I needed for my little ...
customer_reviews.text: This boring bar was just what I needed for my little 9" lathe. As soon as I received it I knocked out a project I had been stalled on.
customer_reviews.author: Hornman47

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: I was at a job shop when I bought this and it worked well. I see no need to buy similar bars for double or triple.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin B.

customer_reviews.title: Lathe Tool
customer_reviews.text: I am a Gunsmith, this is a phenomenal tool, carbide bit cuts very well, all in all, it does exactly what I need it to do!
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Good quality great price
customer_reviews.text: Great price good quality bar. I had to bore a 1.316" hole 10.388" deep and this did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: craig reed

customer_reviews.title: It is a boring job but someone has to do it!
customer_reviews.text: Tool worked great. It saved me time and money as I did not have to buy the oversized drill bits and I could bore to the exact hole size for the tap.
customer_reviews.author: Gurney

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed. Does a good job. Cuts clean and smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Accusize 3/4" & 1" insert type boring bars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality that is always found in Accusize tools. Both bars have an easy to read scale for quick depth reference printed on top of the 45Rc bars. JA, ME, Tool Maker
customer_reviews.author: James H Allen

customer_reviews.title: worked great. Had it out to 4" and it worked ...
customer_reviews.text: Just as pictured. Used it to enlarge holes in DOM tubing, worked great. Had it out to 4" and it worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Elmer T Conner

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the cost
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a quality tool, Very good for the cost. Does the job it's designed for.
customer_reviews.author: SamDeVault

customer_reviews.title: These boring bars are the "real thing"
customer_reviews.text: These boring bars are the "real thing". Very high quality with the bars at 45 Rc & a carefully machined mounting area for the inserts. They are worth the investment. JA, ME: Tool Maker
customer_reviews.author: James H Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the the mini lathe
customer_reviews.text: Used the boring bar for the first time today and I was very pleased at its performance. Did a 2" depth bore in steel and it bored it very accurately very little flex.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff D

customer_reviews.title: The little boring bar worked very well in my mini-lathe
customer_reviews.text: The little boring bar worked very well in my mini-lathe, on a thick chunk of mild steel. Sweet cut, nice finish.
customer_reviews.author: leonard solomon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected, Performs well. Seems to be a very good product for the money
customer_reviews.author: SamDeVault

customer_reviews.title: Looks great..
customer_reviews.text: Looks great.............nice quality, but have not used it yet. I need a 3/4 to 1/2 in. adapter for my tool post holder which I had not made yet .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Quite a bit better quality than I expected. I will definitely look at their other tools.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Accusize Industrial Tools 3/8'' x 6'' Overall Length, Rh Sclcr Indexable Boring Bar with Ccmt21.5 Carbide Inserts, P252-S401
feature_bullets: Using 80 degree carbide CCMT inserts negative 5 degree end and side cutting angle
Boring from light roughing to finishing in small bores
Profiling bar for semi-finishing and finishing operations

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
